name: Sheet Metal Part Bending Project
description: Developed a sheet metal bending program using INFORM II programming language, achieving 100 parts in 3 hours (double the target).
longDescription:
• Developed a sheet metal bending program to bend this part 6 times from scratch using the INFORM II programming language.
• Programs were split into 3 sections, one for picking, one for bending, and one for stacking.
• Parts could only be bent certain ways so I required an "adjustment table" to put the part down and pick it up from another angle to bend it, this adjustment code was included in the bending program.
• Stacking the part required extreme precision and required the robot to move slower than it normally would to ensure no parts fall off the stack and are damaged.
• The robot had to move at a speed fast enough so that 50 parts could be bent in 4 hours safely.
• I was able to guarantee double that in 3 hours.

name: Parallel Linkage Limit Switch Design
description: Designed a limit switch using parallel linkage mechanics out of sheet metal, eliminating previous switch model issues.
longDescription:
• Used SolidWorks to design a limit switch using parallel linkage mechanics out of sheet metal.
• Different thicknesses were used to not waste material while also retaining the strength of the switch.
• Made completely in-house, low cost.
• Previous switch models had issues with parts missing the switch and/or parts being too large for the part to even be bendable.
• This model eliminates both concerns.

name: 2025 Not-A-Boring Competition
description: 3rd place micro-scale Tunnel Boring Machine (TBM) with VFD control system and dead-reckoning navigation.
longDescription:
• Engineered a micro-scale Tunnel Boring Machine (TBM) for the 2025 Not-A-Boring Competition.
• Developed a control system to regulate the excavation rate of the TBM by adjusting the powertrain motor through a Variable Frequency Drive (VFD), ensuring optimal propulsion and excavation efficiency.
• Programmed controls software for the motor's speed, output torque, and current draw through the VFD.
• Developed a robust dead-reckoning-based navigation algorithm for precise TBM positioning and path control using Python.
• Designed the motor, gearbox, and associated couplings in Onshape to withstand the 2200 Nm torque requirement.
• Utilized rapid prototyping to create enclosures and mounts for above and below ground PCB control stations.
• Developed an advanced muck removal system incorporating a venturi pump to effectively dampen and discharge soil during excavation.
• Finished 3rd place.

name: Custom Programming Language
description: Python interpreter for stack-based programs with compiler for opcode parsing and p-code generation.
longDescription:
• Developed a python interpreter to execute stack-based programs, supporting primarily arithmetic operations.
• Created a compiler that parses opcodes (PUSH, POP, etc.) and generates p-code for program execution.

name: 2024 Not-A-Boring-Competition Navigation Challenge
description: 1st place winning autonomous robot with React GUI, SLAM localization, and probabilistic path planning achieving 94% accuracy.
longDescription:
• Developed a comprehensive autonomous navigation system for the Not-A-Boring-Competition held in Austin, Texas.
• Built a React-based GUI to subscribe to ROS2 nodes and display real-time data from published sources.
• Implemented a SLAM-based localization system using Python and Ultra WideBand (UWB) technology.
• Programmed a probabilistic roadmap (PRM) to generate optimal routes with 94% accuracy.
• Designed mechanical subsystem with 1/8th inch aluminum plates, machined axles and wheels.
• Created holders for batteries, UWB, and motor drivers.
• Integrated electrical subsystem with emergency stop, 4 lithium batteries, and 3 motor drivers.
• Achieved 1st place victory at the competition.

name: Kettle Handle
description: Mild steel safety handle for industrial kettles, designed in Inventor and currently in use.
longDescription:
• Created a kettle handle out of mild steel as a safety measure for industrial kettle operations.
• Designed safety handle to prevent injuries from cart pushing and kettle damage.
• Used Autodesk Inventor to create detailed assembly drawings.
• Currently in active use at the manufacturing facility.

name: Tool Stand
description: Mild steel and sheet metal tool stand for safe measuring tool storage.
longDescription:
• Created a Tool Stand out of mild steel and sheet metal for safe measuring tool storage.
• Designed stand to eliminate dangerous ground-level tool storage.
• Prevented back injuries from constant bending to pick up tools.
• Used mild steel and sheet metal construction for durability.
• Currently in active use at the manufacturing facility.

name: Fixture Database Project
description: Database system for 500+ fixtures with search functionality and image upload capabilities for efficient fixture management.
longDescription:
• Created a database system that processes input from 500+ fixtures stored in an Excel file.
• Developed search functionality to quickly locate and retrieve fixture information.
• Implemented image upload feature with a dedicated button for visual fixture identification.
• Built user-friendly interface for accessing comprehensive fixture data and associated images.

name: Unit Locator Project
description: Algorithm that cross-references unit lists with prioritized units, highlighting matches and flagging missing units for efficient inventory management.
longDescription:
• Developed an algorithm that takes a list of units and cross-references it with the prioritized units list.
• Highlighted units that appear on both the prioritized list and master list for easy identification.
• Flagged units that are on the prioritized list but missing from the master list and placed them on a separate page.
• Organized highlighted units into 3 different pages based on unit type for better categorization.
• Calculated the total amount of each unit type on a separate Excel sheet for inventory tracking.

name: Automated Forklift Prototype
description: EV3-based autonomous forklift with RobotC programming and 3D printed components.
longDescription:
• Constructed an autonomous forklift prototype using EV3 robotics and RobotC programming.
• Created detailed flowcharts to map out robot path planning.
• Implemented automatic object detection and lifting logic.
• Programmed autonomous behaviors using RobotC.
• Used EV3 mechanics and 3D printed parts for stable operation.
• Designed forklift system to lift, hold, and drop objects at designated checkpoints.

name: Traffic Light System
description: Arduino-based 4-way stop traffic system with crosswalk and train functionality.
longDescription:
• Developed an Arduino-based traffic light system that mimics a 4-way stop with crosswalk and train functionality.
• Built complete 4-way intersection traffic control system.
• Implemented crosswalk functionality with pedestrian signals.
• Added train detection and warning system.
• Used Arduino programming for traffic light sequencing.
• Constructed with cardboard and scrap materials (except wiring and LEDs).
• Soldered connections and integrated all electrical components.
